section.heading: History
section.item: This page displays your saved bags and queries.
A saved query is a copy of the actual query configuration, while a saved bag contains specific data saved from a particular query.

All queries run are saved in the query history. If you do not give your query a particular name (in the 'Save query' box at the bottom of the query interface), it will be saved as query_x (where x increments for each query run).
Saved bags are created by saving specific data from the results page.

section.heading: Using saved queries
section.item: Click on the query name to display the query in the query builder interface. From here you can edit the query or run it again

section.heading: Using saved bags
section.item: Click on the bag name to view its items in the results page.

section.heading: Deleting saved bags and queries
section.item: Select the check-boxes of the bags or queries you wish to delete and press the appropriate Delete button.
